Key Match Events: Devon Conway and Rachin Ravindra combined for a record 273 for the second wicket
Rachin Ravindra scored his maiden international century with the Master Blaster in the building
Matt Henry, Mitchell Santner, and Trent Boult each contributed to England's downfall with their respective wickets
Pre-Game Insights: New Zealand played like they had been waiting four long years to banish the heartbreak of Lordâ€™s
Both Devon Conway and Rachin Ravindra were making their ODI World Cup bows
Post-Match Reflections: Tom Latham and his bowlers deserved credit for their plans and field placements
England's batsmen made poor decisions to regularly give away wickets
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Wellington pair were making their ODI World Cup bows, domestic teammates when the Black Caps were denied a maiden crown by a boundary countdown after the tied 2019 final
England had earned a convincing 3-1 series win over the Black Caps last month
New Zealand next play three games they will expect to win before encountering the hosts and the stretch of schedule that will determine their semifinal fate
